menuIcons.name: Terrain Park
menuIcons.description: Areas designated for freestyle skiing and riding with natural and constructed elements.

mapIcons.description: Freestyle terrain areas are designated with an orange oval and may contain jumps, hits, ramps, banks, fun boxes, jibs, rails, bump terrain and other constructed or natural terrain features.
mapIcons.name: Twisted Pine Terrain Park

mapIcons.description: Freestyle terrain areas are designated with an orange oval and may contain jumps, hits, ramps, banks, fun boxes, jibs, rails, bump terrain and other constructed or natural terrain features.

menuIcons.name: Snow Tubing
menuIcons.description: Family area designated for inner tube sliding

mapIcons.description: Experience the fun of lift-serviced snowtubing down exciting snow chutes at our Pine Meadows Snowtubing Park.$15/person for 2-hour sessionFri: 5-7, 7-9pmSat/holidays: 10am-Noon, Noon-2, 2-4, (re-groom 4-5) 5-7, 7-9pm Sun: 10am-Noon, Noon-2, 2-4pmFeb 22-25: Noon-2, 2-4pm
mapIcons.name: Pine Meadows Tubing Park

menuIcons.name: Nordic Trails
menuIcons.description: The Purity Spring XC & Nordic Reserve is open and the entire east side of Rte 153 has been skate groomed.

menuIcons.name: Snowshoe Trails
menuIcons.description: Snowshoe trails have decent snow coverage in areas however there are spots with no to thin coverage.

menuIcons.name: Purity Springs Lodging
menuIcons.description: Lots of family-friendly lodging options from cottages and condos to slope-side at the bottom of King Pine!

mapIcons.description: Check-in at our main office here.There are seven guest rooms, all with TV and AC. Downstairs are three living room areas, TV, fireplace, laundry facilities and the main office.
mapIcons.name: Millbrook

mapIcons.description: The Lakeside cottage is next to Purity Lake and has two guest rooms with full bath and locking doors between each unit.
mapIcons.name: Lakeside

mapIcons.description: Overlooking King Pine Ski Area, the King Pine Base Lodge features 17 spacious guest rooms. All rooms have ground level access with full bath and air conditioning. There are also three common rooms with TV and a fireplace in one of them.
mapIcons.name: King Pine Lodging

mapIcons.description: Island View has 2 condo units within it. Each unit is fully furnished with a full kitchen, multiple bedrooms, TV and air conditioning. One unit sleeps 10 and the other sleeps 6.
mapIcons.name: Island View

mapIcons.description: Mountainside has 4 condo units within it. Each unit is fully furnished with a full kitchen, cable TV and multiple bedrooms. Condo units do not include meals.
mapIcons.name: Mountainside

mapIcons.description: Brookside Condo has 3 Bedrooms, 2 baths, with a full kitchen, gas fireplace, airconditioning and television.
mapIcons.name: Brookside

mapIcons.description: This building is located behind Lakeside Cottage and overlooks Purity Lake. It contains an indoor pool, fitness area and locker rooms, three guest rooms with TV and AC, gift shop and common room with TV.
mapIcons.name: The Mill

mapIcons.description: Located above the snowtubing hill during the winter season, the Tecumseh lodge is just a quarter of a mile from the main dining room, indoor pool and adjacent to King Pine Ski Area and ice skating rink. Tecumseh has 8 guest rooms with TV's, a common room with TV, gas fireplace and a dining room.
mapIcons.name: Tecumseh

mapIcons.description: Located above the snowtubing hill during the winter season, the Osceola lodge is just a quarter of a mile from the main dining room, indoor pool and adjacent to King Pine Ski Area and ice skating rink. Osceola has 8 guest rooms with TV's, plus a large common room with TV and gas fireplace.
mapIcons.name: Osceola

mapIcons.description: Located above Tecumseh and Osceola, Carrigain has 5 guest rooms with TV's, a common room with TV and wood fireplace.
mapIcons.name: Carrigain

mapIcons.description: Starr King Lodge has 5 guest rooms with TV's, a common room with TV and gas fireplace and a small kitchen.
mapIcons.name: Starr King

mapIcons.description: The Inn has ten guest rooms (all with full-baths) on the second and third floors.  The Inn Dining Room and kitchen can be found on the main floor.
mapIcons.name: The Inn

menuIcons.name: Purity Springs Main Office
menuIcons.description: All lodging arrivals and check-ins here at the Millbrook Lodge and Main Office

mapIcons.description: The main office is located in the Millbrook Lodge. Contact the main office by phone 603-367-8896 or 800-373-3754 or by email at info@purityspring.com
mapIcons.name: Purity Main Office

menuIcons.name: Indoor Pool & Fitness Center
menuIcons.description: The Mill is open to the public and resort guests.

mapIcons.description: Situated on the same Purity Lake shorefront as the Hoyt family's original lumber mill is The Mill Indoor Pool & Fitness Center. Open to the public and resort guests.The Mill offers a fitness center, spacious bathrooms with lockers, a 50ft indoor pool, a hot tub, fitness programs and training classes, massage therapy and reiki and The Blue Heron Gift Shop.
mapIcons.name: Indoor Pool & Fitness Centre

menuIcons.name: Dining
menuIcons.description: Areas where delicious homemade meals and snacks are found.

mapIcons.description: The Pine Cone Cafe provides delicious, homestyle meals and snacks at a great value, including giant homemade cookies, a guest favorite!Don't miss apres ski at the Trail's End Tavern!
mapIcons.name: The Pine Cone Cafe & Trail's End Tavern

mapIcons.description: Classic, New England-style dining prepared by chef Trevor Tasker.Pub adjacent to the dining room serves menu items as well.
mapIcons.name: Traditions Restuarant

menuIcons.name: Ski Shuttle
menuIcons.description: Offered for King Pine and Purity Spring lodging guests and is available on weekends and holiday periods.

mapIcons.description: Our shuttle is offered for the convenience of King Pine and Purity Spring lodging guests and is available on weekends and holiday periods. The shuttle runs continuous loops between The Inn Dining Room, The Mill Fitness Center, Milt's Place, King Pine base lodge and our lodges above the snowtubing hill. Saturday and holidays: 7:30am-5pmSunday: 7:30am-1:30pm
mapIcons.name: The Inn Dining Room Shuttle Stop

mapIcons.description: Our shuttle is offered for the convenience of King Pine and Purity Spring lodging guests and is available on weekends and holiday periods. The shuttle runs continuous loops between The Inn Dining Room, The Mill Fitness Center, Milt's Place, King Pine base lodge and our lodges above the snowtubing hill. Saturday and holidays: 7:30am-5pmSunday: 7:30am-1:30pm

menuIcons.name: Guest Services
menuIcons.description: Area where tickets can be purchased and questions and information can be answered.

mapIcons.description: Resort questions and information can be answered at King Pine's Guest Service Desk and at our resort information desk, both found in the King Pine Base Lodge.Skiing, snowboarding, snowtubing, ice skating, cross country skiing and snowshoeing tickets can be purchased at the Guest Service Desk.
mapIcons.name: Guest Serives

menuIcons.name: Ski & Snowboard School
menuIcons.description: Meeting place for ski and snowboard lessons.

mapIcons.description: Our PSIA-certified ski and snowboard school has dozens of fun, patient instructors who want nothing more than to see you having fun skiing and riding. Group lessons are available up to four times daily, and private classes are also available.Schedule a lesson at Guest Services when you purchase your lift ticket then meet at the Ski School Building 10 minutes before your lesson.
mapIcons.name: Ski and Snowboard School

menuIcons.name: Rental & Tune Shop
menuIcons.description: Ski and snowboard rental and tune shop.

mapIcons.description: Located on the ground level of the base lodge, King Pineâ€™s rental shop offers the regionâ€™s largest rental inventory of alpine and xc skis, boots, poles, snowboards, helmets, ice skates and more! Many tuning options are available at the Tune Shop, including the exclusive â€œ10/10â€- hot wax and edge sharpening while you wait for only $10!
mapIcons.name: King Pine Rental and Tune Shop

menuIcons.name: Parking
menuIcons.description: Parking areas for ski area and resort guests.

mapIcons.description: Milt's Place parking lot.
mapIcons.name: Parking

mapIcons.description: The Mill Indoor Pool & Fitness Center parking lot. Park here to snowshoe tours and to access the XC ski trails.
mapIcons.name: Parking

mapIcons.description: Pine Meadows Snowtubing parking lot
mapIcons.name: Parking

mapIcons.description: Parking area for The Inn Dining Room and Millbrook Main Office.
mapIcons.name: Parking

mapIcons.description: Main base lodge parking lot.
mapIcons.name: Parking

mapIcons.description: Overflow parking area and XC ski parking.
mapIcons.name: Parking

menuIcons.name: Ski Patrol
menuIcons.description: Basic first aid kits for minor injuries

trails.description: The Beaver Trail is perfect for wildlife viewing during summer and winter! Great for snowshoeing or back-country XC skiing.
trails.name: Beaver Trail

trails.description: Very scenic and a blast on XC skis!
trails.name: Birches Trail

trails.description: Begins from Purity Spring near laundry building. The Brook Trail winds along a scenic babbling brook.
trails.name: Brook Trail

trails.description: This trail offers views and winds through old growth forests. Some hilly areas provide a challenge.
trails.name: Enchanted Forest

trails.description: Beginning at The Mill at Purity Spring, and winding through the NH Audubon property, this ungroomed trail is perfect for snowshoeing.
trails.name: Esker Trail

trails.description: Great views to the scenic bog areas of Purity Lake. Great for snowshoeing or XC skiing!
trails.name: Heath View Trail

trails.description: The lake crossing is an ungroomed trail which crosses over Purity Lake from the King Pine area to Sunset Beach. Please use care while crossing and be aware of changing ice conditions.
trails.name: Lake Trail

trails.description: The Sunset Beach trail is a rolling trail leading from the NH Audubon property to the open fields around Sunset Beach.
trails.name: Sunset Beach Trail

trails.description: Snowshoers can take this trail to visit the Lookout Tower and continue on to the Sexton log cabin. Beyon the cabin are views of Ossipee Valley from Bald Ledge.
trails.name: Tower Trail

lifts.description: The perfect lift for beginnersand children. Just step on and the carpet will do the rest in an easy, non-intimidating fasion.
lifts.name: Bear Rug Carpet

lifts.description: Provides access to all lifts onKing Pine
lifts.name: Black Bear Triple

lifts.description: Take the Polar Bear lift toreach the summit with access to all trails on King Pine including the back side.
lifts.name: Polar Bear Triple

lifts.description: Powder Bear is one of 3lifts included in our Beginner ticket and goes almost to the summit. Acces is to mostly beginner trails and also to the Terrain Park.
lifts.name: Powder Bear Triple

lifts.description: $18/person for 2-hour sessionFri: 5-7, 7-9pmSat/holidays: 10am-Noon, Noon-2, 2-4, (re-groom 4-5) 5-7, 7-9pm Sun: 10am-Noon, Noon-2, 2-4pmFeb 22-25: Noon-2, 2-4pm
lifts.name: Tubing Park Tow
